Over the last few weeks,
we've seen tons of protests in Hong Kong
over a proposed extradition bill.
And this bill would allow the government

to detain people accused of
committing certain crimes

and then send them to
countries or territories

that Hong Kong doesn't have
extradition agreements with.
And notably here, that includes China.
Hong Kong used to be a British colony,

And it now is an autonomous
city state of China,

but it has its own economic
and political system.
And notably here, Hong Kong doesn't abide

by the same censorship

So the people of Hong Kong oppose the bill
